newsitem.title: INDONESIA: PT Timah seeks Busang stake - report.
newsitem.headline: PT Timah seeks Busang stake - report.

text.p: Indonesian mining company PT Tambang Timah has submitted a proposal seeking a five to 20 percent stake in the huge Busang gold find in East Kalimantan, local newspapers reported on Wednesday.
"The minimal stake we are capable of taking in Busang is five percent. The maximum stake is 20 percent," Timah president director Erry Riyana was quoted as saying by Bisnis Indonesia.
Timah officials were not immediately available for comment.
Erry said the proposed five-to-20 percent stakeholding was in line with the state-controlled company's financial situation and sugestions by members of parliament.
Bisnis quoted Erry as saying the proposal was being studied by the Mines and Energy Ministry.
The Neraca daily quoted Erry as saying that Timah, which is also listed in London, was confident of financing its equity in Busang through facilities such as offshore syndicated loans.

Erry said if the Mines and Energy Ministry approved its proposal, the firm would seek the go ahead from the Finance Ministry, which has a 65-percent stake in Timah, and other shareholders at a meeting on February 27 before taking further action.
The government has given Canada's Bre-X Minerals Ltd and Barrick Gold Corp one month from January 17 to settle with their local partners before they get the green light to jointly develop the find.
Bre-X estimates the property to contain at least 57 million ounces of gold worth over $21 billion at current prices.
